MtkSetRegionByPathBlockRange.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*===========================================================================
00002 =                                                                           =
00003 =                       MtkSetRegionByPathBlockRange                        =
00004 =                                                                           =
00005 =============================================================================
00006 
00007                          Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00008                                    MISR
00009                                MISR Toolkit
00010 
00011             Copyright 2005, California Institute of Technology.
00012                            ALL RIGHTS RESERVED.
00013                  U.S. Government Sponsorship acknowledged.
00014 
00015 ============================================================================*/
00016 
00017 #include "MisrSetRegion.h"
00018 #include "MisrCoordQuery.h"
00019 #include "MisrError.h"
00020 #include "MisrUtil.h"
00021 #include "MisrOrbitPath.h"
00022 #include "MisrProjParam.h"
00023 
00037 MTKt_status MtkSetRegionByPathBlockRange(
00038   int path_number,    
00039   int start_block,    
00040   int end_block,      
00041   MTKt_Region *region  )
00042 {
00043   MTKt_status status_code;  /* Return status of this function */
00044   MTKt_status status;       /* Return status */
00045   MTKt_Region rgn;      /* Region structure */
00046   int block;            /* Block loop index */
00047   double min_som_x;     /* Minimum SOM X */
00048   double max_som_x;     /* Maximum SOM X */
00049   double min_som_y;     /* Minimum SOM Y */
00050   double max_som_y;     /* Maximum SOM Y */
00051   double ulc_som_x;         /* Upper left SOM X */
00052   double ulc_som_y;             /* Upper left SOM Y */
00053   double lrc_som_x;             /* Lower right SOM X */
00054   double lrc_som_y;             /* Lower right SOM Y */
00055 
00056   if (region == NULL)
00057     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_NULLPTR);
00058 
00059   /* Check path bounds */
00060   if (path_number < 1 || path_number > 233)
00061     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00062 
00063   /* Check block bounds */
00064   if (start_block > end_block)
00065     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00066 
00067   if (start_block < 1 || end_block > 180)
00068     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00069 
00070   /* Set starting som bounds to the coordinates of the first block  */
00071   status = MtkBlsToSomXY(path_number, MAXRESOLUTION, start_block,
00072              0.0, 0.0, &min_som_x, &min_som_y);
00073   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00074 
00075   status = MtkBlsToSomXY(path_number, MAXRESOLUTION, start_block,
00076              MAXNLINE-1, MAXNSAMPLE-1, &max_som_x, &max_som_y);
00077   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00078 
00079   /* Expand the coordinates appropriately for each block */
00080   for (block = start_block+1; block <= end_block; block++) {
00081 
00082     status = MtkBlsToSomXY(path_number, MAXRESOLUTION, block,
00083                0.0, 0.0, &ulc_som_x, &ulc_som_y);
00084     MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00085     status = MtkBlsToSomXY(path_number, MAXRESOLUTION, block,
00086                MAXNLINE-1, MAXNSAMPLE-1, &lrc_som_x, &lrc_som_y);
00087     MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00088 
00089 #ifdef DEBUG
00090     printf("              %f                               %f\n", ulc_som_x, min_som_x);
00091     printf("%f                  %f    %f               %f\n", ulc_som_y, lrc_som_y, min_som_y, max_som_y);
00092     printf("              %f                               %f\n", lrc_som_x, max_som_x);
00093 #endif
00094 
00095     if (ulc_som_x < min_som_x) min_som_x = ulc_som_x;
00096     if (lrc_som_x > max_som_x) max_som_x = lrc_som_x;
00097     if (ulc_som_y < min_som_y) min_som_y = ulc_som_y;
00098     if (lrc_som_y > max_som_y) max_som_y = lrc_som_y;
00099   }
00100 
00101 #ifdef DEBUG
00102   {
00103     double ulclon, ulclat, lrclon, lrclat;
00104 
00105     MtkSomXYToLatLon(path_number,min_som_x,min_som_y, &ulclat,&ulclon);
00106     MtkSomXYToLatLon(path_number,max_som_x,max_som_y, &lrclat,&lrclon);
00107 
00108     printf("              %f                               %f\n", ulclat, min_som_x);
00109     printf("%f                  %f    %f               %f\n", ulclon, lrclon, min_som_y, max_som_y);
00110     printf("              %f                                %f\n", lrclat, max_som_x);
00111   }
00112 #endif
00113 
00114   /* Determine half of the extent in som x/y for entire block range */
00115   /* hextent is measured from edge pixel center to edge pixel center */
00116   rgn.hextent.xlat = (max_som_x - min_som_x) / 2.0;
00117   rgn.hextent.ylon = (max_som_y - min_som_y) / 2.0;
00118 
00119   if (rgn.hextent.xlat <= 0.0)
00120     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00121 
00122   if (rgn.hextent.ylon <= 0.0)
00123     MTK_ERR_CODE_JUMP(MTK_OUTBOUNDS);
00124 
00125   /* Determine center in geographic coordinates */
00126   status = MtkSomXYToLatLon(path_number, min_som_x + rgn.hextent.xlat,
00127                 min_som_y + rgn.hextent.ylon,
00128                 &(rgn.geo.ctr.lat), &(rgn.geo.ctr.lon));
00129   MTK_ERR_COND_JUMP(status);
00130 
00131   *region = rgn;
00132 
00133   return MTK_SUCCESS;
00134 
00135 ERROR_HANDLE:
00136   return status_code;
00137 }
